translated: As soon as they have this thought, through the power of the Buddha, all the offering articles they wish for appear in their hands.

original: de dag gis me tog nas rol mo'i dbyangs sgra'i bar de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pa byed la /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po tshad med /
analyzed: de dag gis me tog nas rol mo'i dbyangs sgra'i bar de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pa byed la / dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po tshad med /
translated: With those flowers and so on, up to and including music, they make offerings to the blessed buddhas.🔽They also plant and accumulate many roots of virtue,

original: grangs med pa dag kyang bskyed cing gsog go /
analyzed: grangs med pa dag kyang bskyed cing gsog go /
translated: immeasurable and innumerable.

original: gal te me tog gi skon bu rnam pa 'di lta bu lag pa nas 'byung bar gyur cig ces 'dod na yang de dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu lha'i me tog kha dog tha dad pa /
analyzed: gal te me tog gi skon bu rnam pa 'di lta bu lag pa nas 'byung bar gyur cig ces 'dod na yang de dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu lha'i me tog kha dog tha dad pa /
translated: If they wish for a flower basket to appear in their hands, as soon as they have this thought, divine flowers of different colors

original: dri tha dad pa /
analyzed: dri tha dad pa /
translated: and different fragrances

original: dri du ma yod pa'i skon bu dag lag pa nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: dri du ma yod pa'i skon bu dag lag pa nas 'byung ste /
translated: appear in their hands in baskets.

original: de dag gis skon bu'i me tog rnam pa de lta bu de dag @406a *//
analyzed: de dag gis skon bu'i me tog rnam pa de lta bu de dag @406a *//
translated: Those flowers in the basket were of that kind.🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'thor /🔽mngon par 'thor /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'thor / mngon par 'thor /
translated: They scattered those ketaka flowers over those buddha bhagavāns.🔽They scattered them,

original: mngon par rab tu 'thor ro //
analyzed: mngon par rab tu 'thor ro //
translated: they scattered them again,🔽and they scattered them again and again.

original: skon bu'i me tog gtor ba de dag thams cad las nang gi chung du gang yin pa de yang steng gi bar snang la dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam gyi me tog gi gdugs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: skon bu'i me tog gtor ba de dag thams cad las nang gi chung du gang yin pa de yang steng gi bar snang la dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam gyi me tog gi gdugs su 'gyur te /
translated: All those ketaka flowers, the smallest of which was the size of ten leagues, became flower parasols in the sky above.

original: phyi ma shos ma gtor gyi bar snga mas la mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: phyi ma shos ma gtor gyi bar snga mas la mi ltung ngo //
translated: They did not fall until the last flower had been scattered.

original: de na skon bu'i me tog gtor ba gang steng gi bar snang la dpag tshad nyi shu'i tshad tsam gyi gdugs su 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: de na skon bu'i me tog gtor ba gang steng gi bar snang la dpag tshad nyi shu'i tshad tsam gyi gdugs su 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There were ketaka flowers that became flower parasols in the sky above the size of twenty leagues,

original: dpag tshad sum cu dang / bzhi bcu'i tshad tsam yang yod /
analyzed: dpag tshad sum cu dang / bzhi bcu'i tshad tsam yang yod /
translated: thirty leagues, forty leagues,

original: steng gi bar snang la me tog gi gdugs dpag tshad brgya stong gi tshad kyi bar tsam du 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: steng gi bar snang la me tog gi gdugs dpag tshad brgya stong gi tshad kyi bar tsam du 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: up to flower parasols in the sky above the size of a hundred thousand leagues.

original: de na gang dag dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po bskyed cing /
analyzed: de na gang dag dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po bskyed cing /
translated: Those who generated great joy and supreme joy,

original: sems dga' ba chen po thob pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa bskyed nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po la bsnyen bkur byas te /
analyzed: sems dga' ba chen po thob pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa bskyed nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po la bsnyen bkur byas te /
translated: who obtained great joy of mind, generated immeasurable roots of virtue, served many quintillions of buddhas,

original: snga dro gcig la slar log nas 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du gnas so //
analyzed: snga dro gcig la slar log nas 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du gnas so //
translated: and returned in one morning to the world of Sukhāvatī.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yongs su zin pa dang / sngon chos mnyan pa byin pa dang / sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam 'byor zhing yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yongs su zin pa dang / sngon chos mnyan pa byin pa dang / sngon gyi rgyal ba la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam 'byor zhing yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: “Ānanda, through the power of the past aspirations of the blessed thus-gone Amitāyus, and through the power of his past teachings of the Dharma, his past roots of virtue planted in the presence of the victorious ones, and his past aspirations that were fulfilled and perfected,

original: mi nyung ba dang / shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / @406b shin tu bsgoms pas smon lam btab pa 'grub pa /
analyzed: mi nyung ba dang / shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / @406b shin tu bsgoms pas smon lam btab pa 'grub pa /
translated: he made aspirations that were not few, that were very clear, and that were very well cultivated, and they were fulfilled.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing der skyes par gyur pa de dag thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos kyi gtam smra ba dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing der skyes par gyur pa de dag thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos kyi gtam smra ba dag go /
translated: All the bodhisattvas who are born in that buddha realm speak about the Dharma in a way that is connected to omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na sems can gang dag yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'ga' yang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na sems can gang dag yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du shes 'ga' yang mi bskyed do //
translated: In that buddha realm, no sentient beings give rise to any notion of ownership.

original: de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing de kun du 'chag cing rnam par rgyu ba na dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing de kun du 'chag cing rnam par rgyu ba na dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba mi bskyed do //
translated: When they walk and move around in that buddha realm, they do not give rise to any sense of pleasure or displeasure.

original: 'gro ba na yang ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gro'i /
analyzed: 'gro ba na yang ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gro'i /
translated: When they go somewhere, they go without any regard for anything.

original: ltos pa dang bcas par ni ma yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas par ni ma yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not go with any regard for anything.🔽They do not have any of the following:

original: dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnas kyi sems dang / sems de lta bu dag de dag la yod med do //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnas kyi sems dang / sems de lta bu dag de dag la yod med do //
translated: the notion of ownership, the notion of a place, or the notion of a mind.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can der skyes pa de dag la gzhan gyi 'du shes med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can der skyes pa de dag la gzhan gyi 'du shes med /
translated: the bodhisattvas who are born in the realm of Sukhāvatī do not have any notion of other.

original: rang gi 'du shes med /
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes med /
translated: They have no notion of self.

original: bdag gi 'du shes med /🔽'thab pa med /🔽rtsod pa med /
analyzed: bdag gi 'du shes med / 'thab pa med / rtsod pa med /
translated: They have no notion of other.🔽They have no quarrels.

original: mi mthun pa med /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med /
translated: They have no disputes.🔽They have no disagreements.

original: mi mnyam pa'i sems med de /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i sems med de /
translated: They have no thoughts of inequality.

original: de dag ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems dang / 'jam pa'i sems dang / dge ba'i sems dang / rab tu dang ba'i sems dang; brtan pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: de dag ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i sems dang / mnyen pa'i sems dang / 'jam pa'i sems dang / dge ba'i sems dang / rab tu dang ba'i sems dang; brtan pa'i sems dang /
translated: They have an attitude of equality toward all sentient beings, a helpful attitude, a loving attitude, a gentle attitude, a tender attitude, a virtuous attitude, a pure attitude, a stable attitude,

original: sgrib pa med pa'i sems dang / 'khrug pa med pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa spyod pa'i sems @407a *//
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i sems dang / 'khrug pa med pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa spyod pa'i sems @407a *//
translated: an attitude free of obscurations, an attitude free of disturbance, an attitude free of confusion, an attitude of practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: dang; sems kyi rgyud sgyu ma'i rang bzhin la blo rab tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: dang; sems kyi rgyud sgyu ma'i rang bzhin la blo rab tu zhugs pa /
translated: and an attitude that is fully engaged in the nature of illusion.

original: shes rab rgya mtsho chen po dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: shes rab rgya mtsho chen po dang mnyam pa /
translated: Their wisdom is like the great ocean.

original: blo ri rab dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: blo ri rab dang mtshungs pa /
translated: Their intellect is like Mount Meru.

original: yon tan du ma bsags pa; byang chub kyi yan lag yang dag par 'gro bas rnam par brtsen pa /
analyzed: yon tan du ma bsags pa; byang chub kyi yan lag yang dag par 'gro bas rnam par brtsen pa /
translated: He had accumulated many qualities, and he was playful in his perfect progress toward the branches of awakening.

original: sangs rgyas yang dag par 'gro ba la mngon par brtson pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yang dag par 'gro ba la mngon par brtson pa /
translated: He was dedicated to the perfect progress of the buddhas.

original: sha'i mig rab tu rnam par 'byed pa /
analyzed: sha'i mig rab tu rnam par 'byed pa /
translated: He had the discernment of the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i mig mngon par bsgrub pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig mngon par bsgrub pa /
translated: He had accomplished the divine eye.

original: shes rab kyi mig rtogs par khong du chud pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig rtogs par khong du chud pa /
translated: He had realized the eye of insight.

original: chos kyi mig gi pha rol tu son pa /
analyzed: chos kyi mig gi pha rol tu son pa /
translated: He had perfected the eye of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sgrub cing 'chad de ston pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sgrub cing 'chad de ston pa /
translated: He taught, explained, and revealed the eye of the buddhas.

original: rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston cing chags pa med pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa /
analyzed: rgya cher yang dag par rab tu ston cing chags pa med pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa /
translated: He taught extensively and accomplished the wisdom that is free from attachment.

original: khams gsum mnyam pa nyid du mngon par brtson pa /🔽sems dul ba /
analyzed: khams gsum mnyam pa nyid du mngon par brtson pa / sems dul ba /
translated: He was dedicated to the sameness of the three realms.🔽He had a disciplined mind.

original: sems zhi ba /
analyzed: sems zhi ba /
translated: He had a peaceful mind.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with the nonobservation of all phenomena.

original: kun 'byung ba'i nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa /
translated: He was skilled in the etymologies of the origin of suffering.

original: chos kyi nges pa'i tshig dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos kyi nges pa'i tshig dang ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with the etymologies of the Dharma.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la mkhas pa /
translated: He was skilled in the clear and the unclear.

original: tshul dang tshul ma yin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa /
analyzed: tshul dang tshul ma yin pa'i gnas la mkhas pa /
translated: They are skilled in what is proper and improper.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtam la mi lta bar gnas pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtam la mi lta bar gnas pa /
translated: They do not rely on worldly talk.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam rnams kyi snying po rtogs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtam rnams kyi snying po rtogs pa /
translated: They realize the essence of the talk that transcends the world.

original: chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba la mkhas pa /
translated: They are skilled in seeking out all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi bar shes pas gnas pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi bar shes pas gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the knowledge that all phenomena are naturally peaceful.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i spyod yul ba /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i spyod yul ba /
translated: They have a sphere of activity that is free of reference points.

original: ci yang med pa /
analyzed: ci yang med pa /
translated: They are nothing whatsoever.

original: len pa med pa /
analyzed: len pa med pa /
translated: They are free of grasping.

original: sems pa med pa /
analyzed: sems pa med pa /
translated: They are free of thought.

original: phung po med pa /
analyzed: phung po med pa /
translated: They are free of the aggregates.

original: len pa med pas shin tu rnam @407b par grol bar nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: len pa med pas shin tu rnam @407b par grol bar nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: They are completely liberated without grasping, and they are free of afflictions.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la thug pa med par gnas pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la thug pa med par gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the limitless superknowledges.

original: rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa /
translated: They abide without a root.

original: sems chags pa med pa /
analyzed: sems chags pa med pa /
translated: Their minds are free of attachment.

original: zhum pa med pa /
analyzed: zhum pa med pa /
translated: They are free of discouragement.

original: chos zab mo rnams la mngon par brtson pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo rnams la mngon par brtson pa /
translated: They are dedicated to the profound Dharma.

original: sgyid lug pa med pa /
analyzed: sgyid lug pa med pa /
translated: They are free of discouragement.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rtogs par dka' ba la 'jug pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rtogs par dka' ba la 'jug pas /
translated: They engage in the realization of the difficult-to-realize wisdom of the buddhas.

original: 'phags pa bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam rjes su thob pa /
translated: They had attained the path of the noble ones that is traveled by only one person.

original: the tshom med pa /
analyzed: the tshom med pa /
translated: They were free of doubt.🔽They had crossed over uncertainty.

original: dogs pa las brgal pa; shes pa gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
analyzed: dogs pa las brgal pa; shes pa gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
translated: They were not dependent on the knowledge of others.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa /
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal med pa /
translated: They were free of excessive pride.

original: ye shes kyis mngon par 'phags te ri rab dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyis mngon par 'phags te ri rab dang mtshungs pa /
translated: They were exalted by wisdom, like Mount Meru.

original: 'khrugs pa med pa'i blos rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa med pa'i blos rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba /
translated: Their minds were as undisturbed as the ocean.

original: shes rab kyi 'od dang dkar zhing shin tu dkar la dag cing dge ba'i sems dang / gser btso ma'i kha dog 'dra bar snang zhing 'od 'byung ba'i yon tan gyi mchog gis nyi zla'i 'od las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'od dang dkar zhing shin tu dkar la dag cing dge ba'i sems dang / gser btso ma'i kha dog 'dra bar snang zhing 'od 'byung ba'i yon tan gyi mchog gis nyi zla'i 'od las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: Their minds were pure, virtuous, and bright with the light of insight, and they were endowed with the supreme qualities of the light of the color of refined gold that surpassed the light of the sun and moon.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba bzod pas sa dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba bzod pas sa dang mtshungs pa /
translated: They were like the earth, for they endured the virtue and nonvirtue of all beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khru bar 'bab pas chu dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khru bar 'bab pas chu dang 'dra ba /
translated: They were like water, for they flowed to wash away the stains of afflictions.

original: chos thams cad la rlom sems su byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i phyir me'i phung po dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rlom sems su byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i phyir me'i phung po dang mtshungs pa /
translated: It is like a mass of fire, for it burns up all afflictive emotions.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mi chags pa'i phyir rlung dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mi chags pa'i phyir rlung dang 'dra ba /
translated: It is like the wind, for it is not attached to any world.

original: chos thams cad nges par phigs pa dang thams cad du ci yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir padma dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par phigs pa dang thams cad du ci yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir padma dang 'dra ba /
translated: It is like space, for it penetrates all phenomena and is everywhere nothing whatsoever. It is like a lotus, for it is unstained by any world.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa mngon par sgrogs pas dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i @408a *//
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa mngon par sgrogs pas dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i @408a *//
translated: It is like a great rain cloud, for it thunders forth the Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: 'brug chen po dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: 'brug chen po dang mtshungs pa /
translated: It is like a great thunder, for it follows the seasons.

original: chos kyi chu'i char mngon par 'bebs pas char ba chen po dang 'dra ba /🔽tshogs chen po zil gyis gnon pas khyu mchog dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi chu'i char mngon par 'bebs pas char ba chen po dang 'dra ba / tshogs chen po zil gyis gnon pas khyu mchog dang mtshungs pa /
translated: It is like a great rain, for it rains down the water of the Dharma.🔽It is like a bull, for it outshines the great assemblies.

original: sems shin tu mchog tu dul bas glang po che chen po dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu mchog tu dul bas glang po che chen po dang 'dra ba /
translated: It is like a great elephant, for its mind is extremely well-tamed.

original: shin tu dul bas rta cang shes bzang po dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: shin tu dul bas rta cang shes bzang po dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is like a well-trained horse, a fine steed.

original: rtsal dang mi 'jigs pas skrag pa med pa'i phyir ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: rtsal dang mi 'jigs pas skrag pa med pa'i phyir ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge dang 'dra ba /
translated: He is like the king of beasts, a lion, fearless and powerful.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyod pas shing gi rgyal po n+ya gro da dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su skyod pas shing gi rgyal po n+ya gro da dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is like the king of trees, the nyagrodha, sheltering all beings.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi g-yos pas ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi g-yos pas ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang 'dra ba /
translated: He is like Mount Meru, king of mountains, unshaken by any adversary.

original: byams pa tshad med pa bsgoms pas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: byams pa tshad med pa bsgoms pas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is like space, meditating on immeasurable love.🔽He is like the great Brahma, the forerunner of all who would master the wholesome.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi dbang du bya ba'i sngon du 'gro bas tshangs pa chen po dang 'dra ba; gnas su gsog pa med pas bya dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi dbang du bya ba'i sngon du 'gro bas tshangs pa chen po dang 'dra ba; gnas su gsog pa med pas bya dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is like a bird, leaving no trace of his dwelling.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rnam par 'joms pas bya'i rgyal po nam mkha'i lding dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rnam par 'joms pas bya'i rgyal po nam mkha'i lding dang 'dra ba /
translated: He is like the king of birds, Garuda, conquering all adversaries.

original: 'byung bar dka' ba'i phyir au dum wa ra'i me tog dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: 'byung bar dka' ba'i phyir au dum wa ra'i me tog dang mtshungs pa /
translated: He is like the udumbara flower, difficult to find.

original: glang po che ltar shin tu mnyam par bzhags pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa /
analyzed: glang po che ltar shin tu mnyam par bzhags pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa /
translated: He was like an elephant, remaining completely calm and without distraction.

original: dbang po rmugs pa med pa /
analyzed: dbang po rmugs pa med pa /
translated: His senses were not dull.

original: rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa la mkhas pa /
translated: He was skilled in determining the Dharma.

original: bzod pa dang des pa mang ba /
analyzed: bzod pa dang des pa mang ba /

translated: Whoever wishes to quickly establish countless sentient beings in the irreversible state of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and to see that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Amitāyus, and also wishes to take up the especially excellent, perfect array of the adornments of the qualities of a buddha-field, should cross over the great billionfold world system filled with fire in order to listen to this Dharma teaching.

original: dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Having listened to it, with a mind that has fallen away from distraction, he should rejoice from the depths of his heart.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung ba dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / bcang ba dang / yi ger bri ba dang / bsgom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rlabs po che chen po brtsam par bya'o; ;tha na ba gcig 'jos pa de srid du yang gzhan dag la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung ba dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / bcang ba dang / yi ger bri ba dang / bsgom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rlabs po che chen po brtsam par bya'o; ;tha na ba gcig 'jos pa de srid du yang gzhan dag la brjod par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of upholding, mastering, keeping, writing, and cultivating this Dharma teaching, one should commence with great, powerful diligence. Even if it means losing one’s life, one should explain it to others.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba de brgal nas kyang 'gyod pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig kyang bskyed par mi bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: mi pham pa /

translated: Ajita,
